>

I don't see why your rank should have a determination on what sort of judgement they have related to player behavior.

> [{quoted}](name=Pray,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=RKAdwitY,comment-id=0000000000000000,timestamp=2019-05-11T00:08:41.152+0000)
>
> is it possible riot can show mercy for me as i am grandmaster and after 2 week ill be in diamond duoe to decay?

Of course not. Why would your rank have any relevance to this?
The time to think about what your rank is worth to you was **before** you put your fingers to the keyboard.

> i understand i was wrong in saying this...

Then you should understand the reason for the severe penalty you were issued.

> ...but i am chinese myself...

There's no way anyone can verify that, and it doesn't exempt you from the rules even if we could. You don't just get to say racist stuff and then pull the "but I'm x race" card. It doesn't work like that.

> and it was one comment in the game...
>
> ---
> 
> Pray: dies
Pray: without him using r
Pray: boosted chinese
Pray: yeah
Pray: open
Pray: boosted chinese
Pray: ur on dodge list

There was more than just that one comment; the one I picked out was just the most blatant.

> i was also just talking about the mid laner in our game, who had a chinese nickname.

It doesn't matter who you were talking about. It doesn't matter if their screenname is Chinese, you're not allowed to make racist remarks.

Especially remarks that categorically assert that "Chinese always suck at League".

> he is a well known boosted player in high elo...

If you believe they were boosting, report them for it. Otherwise, their behavior is completely irrelevant to your punishment.

> is ther any chance my ban could be reversed so i dont decay out of grandmaster, and instead i be given chat restricitons?

No. Riot holds a strict zero-tolerance policy against racism, and they punish racism with a 14-day suspension on the first verified offense; you should _know_ better than to make racist remarks, and Riot expects as much of you. A Chat restriction would thus be far too lenient for an offense you _know_ you shouldn't be committing.

If the ban causes you to decay out of Grandmaster tier, then that's just the situation you put yourself in. You chose to break the rules - in an egregious way, no less - so you have to accept the consequences.
